newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korea's bond yields close up as buying dies out.
newsitem.headline: S.Korea's bond yields close up as buying dies out.

text.p: Yields on three-year benchmark corporate bonds finished higher on Tuesday as most institutional investors stayed awayed from the market, brokers said.
Despite fewer new issues, estimated at 51.5 billion won, institutions can not afford to buy bonds, they said.
"Institutions are short in cash as the year-end approaches," said Park Ho-won of LG Securities. "Short-term money market is also likely to turn tight in the near term."
Traders said they expected the yields to rise further on Wednesday in similar trading.
Three-month certificates of deposit yields also gained as buying power faded out.
Overnight call rates remained unchanged at an average of 14.5 percent.
